English Sentence: However, there are fascinating and very unique aspects of these walking marriages.
Spanish Sentence: Tengo 24 años y soy madre de un niño de 2 años y medio.

English Sentence: First, even among couples who are together for months/years/decades, they generally will never actually live together, or share property.
Spanish Sentence: El padre de mi hijo y yo estamos separados desde agosto.

English Sentence: The man will continue to live in his family's home, and his responsibilities are to that family; while the woman will continue to live her her home, and be responsible to her family.
Spanish Sentence: Quiero empezar a salir con otras personas y el padre de mi hijo dice que si lo hago no tendrá nada que ver con su hijo.

English Sentence: The man will visit her at night, but the rest of the time they generally live separate lives.
Spanish Sentence: Es muy posesivo y controlador, pero no tiene derecho a ser así porque ya no estamos juntos.

English Sentence: And what if they have a baby? In general, fathers have little or no responsibility for children produced from such unions;
Spanish Sentence: Tiene demasiadas cosas en su vida en este momento y cree que podemos arreglarlo cuando ya le he dicho demasiadas veces que no le quiero y que él tampoco me quiere.

English Sentence: the baby will be raised in the mother's home, and be a part of her family, not the father's.
Spanish Sentence: Quiero que esté allí para su hijo sin necesidad de mí también.

English Sentence: However, that does not mean that the men have no responsibility...it is just that the focus of that responsibility is shifted.
Spanish Sentence: Pero él no tiene a nadie, su familia y él no se llevan bien y tienen sus propios problemas.

English Sentence: In most cultures, a man will be responsible to care for his own children;
Spanish Sentence: No quiero volver a ser miserable y cuanto más tiempo mase, más miserable seré.

English Sentence: in Mosuo culture, a man is responsible to care for the children of his sisters/nieces/aunts/etc. So Mosuo men still have full parenting responsibilities...perhaps even moreso, since they may end up sharing responsibility for the children of many family members.
Spanish Sentence: No quiero que no esté allí para su hijo, ya que es un buen padre, o al menos, lo intenta.

English Sentence: Now, in some cases, Mosuo men DO want to be involved in their own childrens' upbringing.
Spanish Sentence: Creo que cada niño necesita a ambos padres, tanto si están juntos como si no.

English Sentence: If that is the case, after the child is born, the father will go to the mother's home, and present the family matriarch with gifts, asking to be accepted as the father.
Spanish Sentence: Pero él piensa que si él no puede tenerme, nadie puede.

English Sentence: If the matriarch accepts him, he is then an 'honorary member' of the family, and has the right to visit and/or stay there like any other family member, and to help raise the child.
Spanish Sentence: ¿Qué debo hacer para seguir con mi vida?

English Sentence: However, this is not a frequent practice.
Spanish Sentence: Tu ex te amenaza con usar a tu hijo... malo, malo, malo.

English Sentence: Although this sounds very strange at first, it actually provides remarkable stability for the children.
Spanish Sentence: No puedo ceder, o esto escalará.

English Sentence: First, they are not raised by just one parent; everyone in the family shares in parental duties, so the child really ends up having multiple father and mother figures.
Spanish Sentence: Tienes derecho a vivir tu propia vida y ser feliz, así que no te rindas ante sus amenazas.

English Sentence: Furthermore, if the mother and father end their relationship, there is virtually no impact or stress for the child.
Spanish Sentence: Si realmente ama a su hijo, lo verá independientemente de eso, pero esto solo es un método de control típico que usan las personas como él.

English Sentence: There's no fighting over splitting property, because they never shared property.
Spanish Sentence: Otros dicen cosas como «Voy a suicidarme si me dejas»... ¿entiendes?

English Sentence: There's no fighting over custody of the child, because the child never belonged to the father to begin with.
Spanish Sentence: Fecha.

English Sentence: The mother's relationships with different men may change, but it has little or no effect on the children.
Spanish Sentence: Conoce a todo tipo de personas.

English Sentence: One more thing I'd like to point out. While this system actually works very effectively for the Mosuo, it works ONLY in a situation where there is a large extended family to provide support.
Spanish Sentence: Haz lo que quieras.

English Sentence: For those Mosuo men and women who leave home to live/work on their own in other cities, they almost always choose more traditional marriage.
Spanish Sentence: Si sale voluntariamente de vuestras vidas, probablemente esté mejor sin él.

English Sentence: After all, caring for a baby without its father when you have 20 other people in your home to help you is one thing;
Spanish Sentence: Estoy de acuerdo, otra cosa es que no sea de su incumbencia si sales o no.

English Sentence: caring for a baby without its father when you live by yourself is another matter entirely.
Spanish Sentence: No se lo diría.

English Sentence: For more information about the Mosuo, their culture, and our work with them, you can check out our organization's website. And I welcome questions and comments about this, or other aspects of Mosuo culture.
Spanish Sentence: No por su amenaza, sino porque tu vida personal no es de su incumbencia.

English Sentence: While their way of life holds no particular allure to me (my job consists of sitting, writing on paper and thinking about things, I am allergic to horses, my greatest joy is my western traditional family of my wife and 2 daughters) I applaud your efforts to provide as unobtrusive assistance to these people as possible.
Spanish Sentence: ¿Puedes documentar sus amenazas?

English Sentence: How Long are We Going to Tolerate Japan?
Spanish Sentence: ¿Cuánto tiempo vamos a tolerar a Japón?

English Sentence: My fellow citizens:
Spanish Sentence: Conciudadanos:

English Sentence: Hello, everyone! We all know the "September 18th" Incident, but now Japan again has a premeditated plan for another "September 18th" on the sea, another "Lugou Bridge on the sea".
Spanish Sentence: ¡Hola a todos! Todos conocemos el incidente del 18 de septiembre, pero ahora Japón nuevamente tiene un plan premeditado para otro 18 de septiembre en el mar, u otro Puente Lugou en el mar.

English Sentence: Japan surprisingly defied the strong condemnation of the whole world, openly invaded our country's sacred territory, "the Diaoyu Islands".
Spanish Sentence: Japón desafió sorprendentemente la fuerte condena del mundo entero, invadió abiertamente el territorio sagrado de nuestro país, las Islas Diaoyu.

English Sentence: As we all know, the "Diaoyu Islands" have always belonged to China; due to historical reasons, what originally belongs us has become controversial.
Spanish Sentence: Como todos sabemos, las Islas Diaoyu siempre han pertenecido a China; debido a razones históricas, lo que originalmente nos pertenece se ha vuelto controvertido.

English Sentence: My fellow citizens, ours is ours, what need is there to negotiate! Japan thus goes even further - wants to create a fact of occupation. Can we allow this? No - absolutely not!
Spanish Sentence: ¡Mis conciudadanos, nuestro es nuestro, qué necesidad hay de negociar! Japón va aún más lejos, quiere crear un hecho de ocupación. ¿Podemos permitir algo así? ¡De ninguna manera!

English Sentence: My fellow citizens, Japan's militarism has brought the people of Asia grave disasters.
Spanish Sentence: Mis conciudadanos, el militarismo de Japón ha traído al pueblo de Asia grandes desastres.

English Sentence: Especially China suffered the ravages of Japan for as long as several decades.
Spanish Sentence: Especialmente China sufrió los estragos de Japón durante décadas.

English Sentence: In the Northeast, Japanese Unit 731 cruelly conducted human body experiments on living people of China, Korea and other countries, the method of which were extremely brutal; the Nanjing Massacre added a layer of blood to the ancient capital which will never fade away; the big bloody battles at Hengyang and Changsha laid bare the bones of the dead over a thousand kilometers and killed off everything ...
Spanish Sentence: En el noreste, la Unidad japonesa 731 llevó a cabo crueles experimentos con cuerpos humanos en personas vivas de China, Corea y otros países, cuyo método fue extremadamente brutal, la masacre de Nanjing añadió una capa de sangre a la antigua capital que nunca se desvanecerá, las grandes batallas en Hengyang y Changs desnudaron los huesos de los muertos a más de mil kilómetros y lo mataron todo.

English Sentence: My fellow citizens, of the heinous crimes committed by Japan in China, there are too many instances to cite, difficult to record without exhausting all bamboo strips.
Spanish Sentence: Mis conciudadanos, de los atroces crímenes cometidos por Japón en china, hay demasiados casos para citar, difíciles de registrar sin agotar todas las  tiras de bambú.

English Sentence: It's just as if those ten million deceased souls who lost their lives are wandering over the Pacific Ocean, finding it difficult to rest in peace.
Spanish Sentence: Es como si esos diez millones de almas muertas que perdieron la vida vagaran por el océano Pacífico, encontrando difícil descansar en paz.

English Sentence: All the people who experienced that era must still remember it vividly; even our younger generations also will cry with tears streaming down our cheeks, and our blood boils with indignation, whenever we turn to this page of history and read!
Spanish Sentence: Todas las personas que experimentaron esta época todavía deben recordarla vívidamente; incluso nuestras generaciones más jóvenes lloran, las lágrimas recorren sus mejillas, y nuestra sangre hierve con indignación cada vez que pasamos a esta página de la historia y leemos.

English Sentence: Now Japan actually wants to reverse the verdict on the history of its aggression - fellow citizens, fellow Chinese in Asia, wake up!
Spanish Sentence: Ahora Japón quiere revertir el veredicto sobre la historia de su agresión, conciudadanos, compañeros chinos en Asia, ¡despierten!

English Sentence: Although it is painful to look back at these hundred years of shame, we must go face it; although historical issues have not been resolved, let us create and choose history!
Spanish Sentence: Aunque es doloroso mirar hacia atrás a esos cien años de vergüenza, debemos enfrentarlo; aunque los problemas históricos no se hayan resuelto, ¡creemos y elijamos la historia!

English Sentence: Since there is responsibility, we are not afraid. The territory is small, but it is related to the matter of dignity; no matter how the winds and clouds changes, the interests of the country and national unity are the guarantee of honor; even though scarred with wounds, we can not let our native lands be separated!
Spanish Sentence: Como hay responsabilidad, no tenemos miedo. El territorio es pequeño, pero está relacionado con el tema de la dignidad, no importa cómo cambien los vientos y las nubes, los intereses del país y la unidad nacional son la garantía de honor; aunque esté lleno de heridas, ¡no podemos dejar que nuestras tierras natales se separen!

English Sentence: My fellow citizens, for the Chinese nation, the advent of the twenty-first century means a time when we are beset with difficulties inside while being pressed from outside, and we will face many challenges.
Spanish Sentence: Mis conciudadanos, para la nación china, el advenimiento del siglo veintiuno significa un momento en el que nos vemos acosados por dificultades dentro de nosotros mientras nos presionan desde fuera, y nos enfrentamos a muchos desafíos.

English Sentence: The Taiwan issue, the Tibet issue, the South China Sea issue, the surrounding environment, as well as the foreign forces which are aggressive to China - which way should we go?
Spanish Sentence: El problema de Taiwán, el problema de Tíbet, el problema del mar del Sur de China, el entorno de nos rodea, así como las fuerzas agresivas con China, ¿por dónde debemos ir?

English Sentence: What to do, fellow citizens? Please take a look at the map of the world, that crescent-shaped encirclement is suppressing our breathing, strangling our development, and coveting our national territory.
Spanish Sentence: ¿Qué hacemos conciudadanos? Por favor, eche un vistazo al mapa del mundo, ese cerco en forma de medialuna reprime nuestra respiración, estrangulando nuestro desarrollo y codiciando nuestro territorio nacional.
